contest-event.event-date:
July 10, 1876 D Middlesbrough Contest
Middlesbrough Contest 0 Other
middlesbrough-contest
None
Own Choice Test Piece Contest
Albert Grounds, Middlesbrough Promoted by Middlesbrough Model Band
See http://www.ibew.org.uk/misc4287.htm
Prizes: 1st: £30 2nd: £18 3rd: £10 4th: £5
Whitworth Brass Band, 21 performers, leader Mr J. Raine, conductor Mr T. Woods, "Reminiscences of Verdi", "Marino Faliero", Donizetti. Linthwaite Brass Band, 24 performers, conductor Mr E. Swift, "William Tell", Rossini, Operatic selection, Mozart. Staleybridge Old Brass Band, 24 performers; conductor E. Swift, "Le Prophete", Meyerbeer, "Tanhauser", Wagner. Meltham Mills Brass Band, 24 performers, conductor J. Gladney,Esq., "Elijah", Mendelssohn; Operatic selection. The bands having played the pieces allotted to them, a solo cornet contest took place, the prize offered being one of Besson's desideratum cornets, value £10 10s. Ten competitors were entered, but of these only the following mounted the platform: Mr H. Peers, Staleybridge; Mr J. Raine, Whitworth Band; Mr J. Allen; Mr H. Milburn, Middlesbrough; Mr A. Owen, Meltham Mills; Mr W. A. Monk, Dewsbury Old Band.
July 22, 2011, 11:20 a.m. Nov. 11, 2012, 9:33 p.m.
1 Meltham and Meltham Mills Band John Gladney Jnr Elijah [arr. Gladney]
2 Stalybridge Old Band Edwin Swift Le Prophete [arr. Winterbottom]
3 Linthwaite Silver Band Edwin Swift William Tell [arr. Swift]
4 Whitworth & Spennymoor Silver Prize Band Thomas Woods Reminiscences of Verdi
Withdrawn Bramley Temperance Unknown
Withdrawn Buttershaw Mills (Bradford) Unknown
Withdrawn Dewsbury Band Unknown
Withdrawn Saltaire Band Unknown
Withdrawn Yorkshire Evening Post Band Unknown
